Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by falsely accusing the five Republican co-sponsors of H.R. 8 of joining Democrats to create a "firearms registry" when the bill specifically prohibits it.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or specific details to back up its accusation.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that the five Republican co-sponsors are joining Democrats to institute a firearms registry without any evidence to support this assumption.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the bill in question explicitly prohibits the establishment of a national firearms registry.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation provided by Daniel Webster, director of the Johns Hopkins Center for Gun Policy and Research, who suggests that the confusion and false accusations may be intentional as a political tactic to avoid discussing the substance of the bill.
